turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about AIDA interactive educational freeware diabetes simulator.
turn.2: However, an important group of health-carers involved in the provision of day-today care for many people with diabetes are primary care physicians (general practitioners [GPs]).
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: A workshop was held in September 2000 in Italy — by an independent diabetologist / endocrinologist unconnected with the AIDA simulator's development — to gain experience with application of the AIDA diabetes simulation approach as a teaching tool for general practitioners (GPs).
turn.6: Feedback obtained from participants attending the workshop was very positive, with GPs reporting the simulation approach to be both of interest and use.
turn.8: Another important group of health-carers involved in the provision of day-to-day care for many people with diabetes are nurses.
turn.9: Did any other health-care workers use the program?
turn.10: A separate workshop was held in June 2001 in Italy — by the same independent diabetologist / endocrinologist — to gain experience with application of the AIDA diabetes simulation approach as a teaching tool for student nurses.
turn.11: Did the students like the program?
turn.12: Feedback obtained from participants attending the workshop was generally very positive, with the student nurses also reporting the simulation approach to be both of interest and of use.
